activities.loc: Br 9 - Law Enforcement Center - Lower Level

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Anthony P Daniels

records.addlTxt: from Racine County Alternatives Program - Incident Report

8:38 AM Defendant Anthony P Daniels in court.  Attorney Grant Ian Henderson in court for Anthony P Daniels.  Prosecuting attorney Antoinette L. Rich in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court reporter:  Linda Matoska. 
Defendant did test the other day and was negative for all substances.
BTC: Bench warrant and bond forfeiture vacated.
RCAP report dated September 9th stating defendant has not tested, however, he did test the other day.
Court admonishes defendant regarding RCAP testing and appearing timely for Court.
Defense requests to set for status with other case that is set for trial.
BTC: Set for status on date of trial with other file.
Status conference scheduled for November 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Status conference on November 29, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Return on warrant on September 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.

9:06 AM Defendant Anthony P Daniels not in court.  Attorney Grant Ian Henderson in court for Anthony P Daniels.  Prosecuting attorney Dirk Christian Jensen in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter:  Nancy Szeklinski. 
Defendant does not appear, defense is uncertain why he does not appear.
Defendant has a history of not appearing or not appearing on time along with RCAP violations.
BTC: Bench warrant and bond forfeiture authorized.
from Racine County Alternatives Program - Incident Report

9:35 AM Defendant Anthony P Daniels in court, in custody.  Attorney Grant Ian Henderson in court for Anthony P Daniels.  Prosecuting attorney Barry J Braatz in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter:  Nancy Szeklinski. 
BTC: Warrant vacated.
Defense states that defendant was in COVID quarantine and is why he did not appear at last hearing, requests to reinstate bond.
State requests to increase cash bail based on RCAP violations.
BTC: Bond reinstated.
Return on warrant on September 2, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Bail/Bond Forfeiture Hearing on September 30, 2022 at 09:15 am.
missed court on 8-29-22

9:25 AM Attorney Grant Ian Henderson in court for Anthony P Daniels.  Prosecuting attorney Lucas P. Bennewitz in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court Reporter:  Nancy Szeklinski.  The court calendared this court date based on the RCAP violations.  Defense indicates the deft. is at home with COVID.  Defense informs the court he missed court because he also had COVID at that time.  The court notes he has missed court in the past and is not compliant with RCAP testing.  Defense should provide testing information.  BTC:  No appearance by defendant, Arrest/Bench Warrant requested/ordered, bond to be forfeited.
Bail/bond hearing on August 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.
from Racine County Alternatives Program - Incident Report

8:46 AM Prosecuting attorney Chris D Steenrod in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Anthony P Daniels in court.  Attorney Grant Ian Henderson in court for Anthony P Daniels. Court Reporter: Saige Smith. 
Defense requests another status in September, will attempt to resolve.
Status conference scheduled for September 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on September 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.
from Racine County Alternatives Program - Incident Report

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any alcohol.  This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance. No contact with the victim J.E (person, property, residence or family).

**AMENDED 6/14/2022:  Defendant may see child in common between victim and defendant with parties using a third party for child exchange.**

8:39 AM Prosecuting attorney Diane M. Donohoo in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Anthony P Daniels in court.  Attorney Addison Kuhn for Grant Ian Henderson in court for Anthony P Daniels. Court Reporter:  Darlene Shue. 
Defense requests new status hearing.  Defendant is requesting to review bond.
State ready for bond hearing.
Defense is requesting to modify no contact order to no violent contact to allow him to see his child.
State obj.
BTC: Bond motion denied.  No contact to stay in place.  Parties can use a third party to have contact with the child.
Status conference scheduled for July 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on July 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.
by DA to Defense to Obtain Copies of Certain Evidence.
NG plea entered.

9:36 AM Prosecuting attorney Brooke L Erickson in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Anthony P Daniels in court.  Attorney Grant Ian Henderson in court for Anthony P Daniels. Court Reporter Mark Garvin. 
Waiver of Preliminary hearing filed.  Probable cause found;  bound over. 
Defense moves to address bond, lifting the no contact with the victim of the case.
State objects to bond modification with concerns.
Victim is present in the hearing room, Victim states they feel safe and want the no contact dropped.
BTC: Motion to modify bond lifting no contact order is denied.
Status conference scheduled for June 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on June 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions: Make all court appearances on time. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit. It is a condition of this bond that the defendant NOT consume or possess any alcohol.  This is to be monitored through random drug screens and/or breathalyzers by the Racine County Alternatives Program, Room MC340 (Law Enforcement Center 717 Wisconsin Ave Racine WI 53403). New referrals from Court must report on the day of their Court appearance.  Jail releases must report the following business day (M-Fr 8am-4:30pm).  In addition to random testing, the defendant is further ordered to test after each court appearance. No contact with the victim J.E (person, property, residence or family).
